org.nodes.util

Class Series

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nodes.util.Series
  • Type Parameters:
    T - 

    public class Series
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides helpful functions for defining series of numbers as lists. When possible lists are defined as custom lightweight implementations of the list interface. For instance the list of numbers between a and b separated by steps of c is implemented as a class storing just those three values. One of the advantages of the methods is that they provide an elegant way of iterating over a range of number, eg: for(int i : series(100) { } for(int i : series(-15, 15) { } for(int i : series(-25, 5, 25) { } It should be noted, however, that this is slower than the traditional for loop, especially for many nested loops. This is in part due to compiler optimizations and partly due to the cost of creating iterators.

    • Method Detail

      • series

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> series(int to)

        Returns a series of integers from 0 (inclusive) and up to a given value (exclusive)

        If to is negative, it is interpreted as an exclusive lower bound and the series counts from 0 backwards.

        If to is 0, an empty list is returned.

        Examples:

        Series.series(3)
        // [0, 1, 2]
        Parameters:
        to - The upper bound for the series
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable list of integers

      • series

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> series(int from,
                                       int to)
        Returns a series of integers from a given value (inclusive) and up to a given value (exclusive). If from == to, the series will be empty. If from > to, the series will count backwards. It will include the form value and exclude the to value.
        Parameters:
        from - The starting value. Always included in the series unless equal to to.
        to - The bound. Never included in the list
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable list of numbers containing all integers between and the parameters.

      • series

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> series(int from,
                                       int step,
                                       int to)
        Returns a series of integers from a given value to a given value with a given step size.
        Parameters:
        from - The starting value. Always included in the resulting series unless equal to to.
        step - The distance between successive elements in the returned list.
        to - The bound, never included in the resulting series.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable list of numbers containing all integers between and including the parameters for the given step size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if
        • the step size is 0
        • the step size is negative and from < to
        • the step size is positive and from > li

      • series

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> series(double to)
        Returns a series of double values from 0 (inclusive) and below a given value, with a step size of 1.0.
        Parameters:
        to - The upper bound for the series
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable list of integers

      • series

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> series(double from,
                                      double to)
        Returns a series of double values from a given value (inclusive) and up to a given value. From must always be smaller than to.
        Parameters:
        from - The starting value. The list will always include at least this value so long as to > from
        to - The upper bound.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable list of numbers containing all integers between and including the parameters. If to <= from then the method returns an empty list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if from > to.

        step -
        to -
        Returns:

      • ranges

        public static <T extends java.lang.Number> java.util.List<Range> ranges(java.util.List<T> series)
        Returns a list of ranges correspondong to the given series. For instance the series (1, 2, 3, 4) would generate the ranges (1:2, 2:3, 3:4).
        Returns:

      • ranges

        public static <T extends java.lang.Number> java.util.List<Range> ranges(java.util.List<T> series,
                                                        boolean includeEdges)
        Returns a list of ranges correspondong to the given series. For instance the series (1, 2, 3, 4) would generate the ranges (-inf:1, 1:2, 2:3, 3:4, 4:inf).
        Parameters:
        includeEdges - Whether to include ranges including infinity at the beginning and end
        Returns:
